intro: Eupatorium schickendantzii, commonly known as Schickendantz’s boneset, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and is known for its aromatic, slightly bitter leaves. It has historical use in traditional medicine for its purported diaphoretic and antipyretic properties. Its common name reflects its historical use in treating fevers and chills.
